title: Update site branding to 'Yono Store' and retry build/deploy configuration

requirements.text: Set the website/app name to "Yono Store" across the frontend UI wherever the product name is displayed (e.g., header/brand label, home page hero/title if present, admin area header).

quotes: Retry with website name Yono Store

acceptanceCriteria: The primary visible site branding text reads "Yono Store" on public pages.
The primary visible site branding text reads "Yono Store" in the admin area (if admin UI has a header/title).
No user-facing site branding strings show the old/placeholder name.

requirements.text: Set default HTML document metadata to use "Yono Store" (at minimum: document title) so browser tabs and shared previews use the updated site name where applicable.

quotes: Retry with website name Yono Store

acceptanceCriteria: The browser tab title defaults to "Yono Store" on initial load.
Routes that do not override page metadata still show "Yono Store" as the base title.

requirements.text: Update any in-repo user-facing documentation or on-screen onboarding/help text (if present) to refer to the website as "Yono Store".

quotes: Retry with website name Yono Store

acceptanceCriteria: Any user-facing documentation pages or visible help text (if present) reference "Yono Store" and not a placeholder name.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.

Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any files in frontend/src/components/ui; compose/wrap instead if needed.
Backend must remain single-actor; keep Motoko logic in backend/main.mo; only add migration.mo if an upgrade requires it.
nonGoals: Do not add new product features beyond renaming/rebranding to "Yono Store".
Do not change authentication approach or add third-party auth providers.
Do not introduce non-supported stack components (e.g., Next.js, Node/Express, external databases).
